title.narrative: OUTP 7.2: INCLUSIVE SOCIAL POLICY & BUDG

description.narrative: Output 7.2: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and national capacity to legislate, plan, budget and fund inclusive social policies., which contributes to Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7.2: Strengthened political commitment, accountability and national capacity to legislate, plan, budget and fundinclusive social policies.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s evidence-based advocacy on the social sector allocation and introduction ofthe ‘Child Budgeting Series’ – a knowledge exchange platform on public financeresulted in 3.6% share of public spending (above the 2% target) onhealth, education and social protection benefiting children, increase in health expenditure from 7% (2020) to 13% (2021) and allocation of USD 3.5 million by the Government for the procurement of traditional vaccine for the second consecutive year. The Inter-Governmental Fiscal Transfers ;Administrative Manual developed with UNICEF’s support is improving sub-national capital budget planning and execution in support of the devolution agenda of the Government. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:02/02/2022
